title: Animation-Based Breastfeeding Physiology Education Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical terminology and general comprehension of human physiology
context.additional_context: Animation content optimized for mobile environments, requiring integration with learner-paced progress management systems

learning_goals: Learners can explain hormonal mechanisms (prolactin, oxytocin, etc.) that promote the milk secretion process.
Learners can visually analyze physiological changes in breast tissue (alveolar expansion, duct dilation, etc.) during lactation.
Learners can use animated content to explain the principles of breast pressure generation and milk flow pathways in three distinct stages.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
